dt: {bc}the act of perceiving someone or something as being not the same and often treating as separate or different {bc}the {d_link|distinguishing|distinguish} of a difference

dt.t: without {wi}distinction{/wi} as to race, sex, or religion

dt: {bc}the quality or state of being distinguishable

dt.t: no {wi}distinction{/wi} of facial features in the twins

dt: {bc}the quality or state of being excellent or superior {bc}the quality or state of being {d_link|distinguished|distinguished} or worthy

dt.t: holds the {wi}distinction{/wi} of being the only American to win the prize
Mr. Hemingway's … prose is of the first {wi}distinction{/wi}.

shortdef: the act of perceiving someone or something as being not the same and often treating as separate or different : the distinguishing of a difference; also : the difference distinguished
the quality or state of being distinguishable
